ygData.msgSnippet: I hate to give stuff away, but here it is. The Rocak somehow created an element from Energon that was loosing it s radioactive properties. This element is not

 I hate to give stuff away, but here it is. The Rocak somehow created 
an element from Energon that was loosing it's radioactive properties. 
This element is not unheard of,but the process is only known in 
nature. I don't think I've quite decided what its there for yet. The 
original pyramids of Peru were mad from this stuff(the Incas just had 
a cargo cult LOOK IT UP) and when Mustex takes a sample he gets a 
blast of energon and discovers that these pyramids actually form a 
Rocak transmitter literally the size of Peru. Also he discovers that 
the Rocak created this entire galaxy as a giant energy generator and 
our moons job was to beam the energy to them.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "rAuq" <rauq@t...> wrote:
> Just because there is no rule doesn't mean that it allowed. Too 
> many rules makes for a sad rpg, but oposite to that, too few also 
> makes for a sad rpg. We've brought rule creating to where it is 
now, 
> and we don't really want to create many more rules. There is no 
> rule about naming other people's characters, but there is a rule 
> about calling their characters by their names if the names haven't 
> been said. There is no rule about naming a new element, but that 
> isn't the problem, it is what the element can to that makes us 
> question your motives. There is no rule about having a base around 
> the moon, but likewise, there isn't a rule that says that it would 
be 
> allowed. Since the council now know of what you want to do, the 
> we can talk about it, and decide what to allow, and what not to. 
> There are more unspoken rules, things that you just don't do, than 
> written ones. From now on, I suggest you ask the council about 
> anything that isn't (or is) in the rules. Even if it's not there, 
it could 
> still be disallowed, and we don't want to have you start posting 
> about something absurd and causing an uproar like what happened 
> with the Alliance story.
> 
> Also, read the post entitled " - A - u - t - o - b - o - t - s - " 
written 
> by me, there's an ooc message after it that concerns you. 
> Hopefully, you will find it helpful. =)
> 
> On 31 Jul 2001, at 22:37, dewboy30816@y... wrote:
> 
> >  I've already read the rules. The problem is that with what I 
> > concider the major rules to remember it's hard to remember the 
minor
> > ones like posting when you leave. On another rpg I wrote for my 
first
> > entree that I had barely survived 2 years on the planet Nagas. By 
the
> > way I'll go read over them,but I'm pretty sure there are no rule
> > against naming other players characters, naming a new element
(I'll do
> > that later), or declaring that the moon is really a giant robot 
that I
> > may later use as a base(I just want to know if you can list it on 
the
> > map).
> >
